column12: df+1 ⏵ f,f+2,3 ⏵ db+1,4 T! ⏵ f,f+4 ⏵ (long dash) f,f+2,1
f,f+2,3 ⏵ db+1,4 T! ⏵ f,f+4 ⏵ (long dash) f,f+2,1

column2:
Can perform Naniwa Gusto moves at any time
during Heat.
column7: Safe mid attack to fish for a Heat activation.

column17:
hit the opponent with
certain moves to stock it

column7: Useful in punish situations. The first hit high crushes.
Very evasive option out of sidestep.
Single jab to check situations. It has useful extensions.
Strong homing attack to check sidestepping opponents.

Mid option to check situations and poke. The extensions 
 are risky, but useful against players that challenge it.

column12: f,f+4 ⏵ f,f+2,3 ⏵ db+1,4 T! ⏵ f,f+4 ⏵ (long dash) f,f+2,1

column7:
Good button to stop opponents from approaching. 
 Commit to just b+3 and try to hit confirm into b+3,4,3.
column12: f,f+2,3 ⏵ db+1,4 T! ⏵ f,f+4 ⏵ (long dash) f,f+2,1

column7:
A jumping counterhit launcher that can be used 
 for approaching at midrange.

Both lows create a bit of spacing on hit, which can be used 
 to bait the opponent into whiffing or falling for her keepout 
 buttons. Don't look at them as mixup tools but as a way 
 to annoy defensive opponents.

column3:
can also be converted into a 
combo with a tricky dash into 1+4

column7:
A fast low/high counterhit launcher that jumps quite fast 
 over low attacks. Useful against opponents overextending 
  in their pressure.

A mid attack that changes properties the longer you hold 
 the input for. Becomes an unblockable when fully charged. 
 Very useful in some okizeme setups.

column12: After most combos T! ⏵ f,f+4 ⏵ dash ⏵ Heat Burst ⏵ ender
End with f+1+2 for wall break and 2,1,d+1+2 to break floor.

For a lot of wall carry without Heat Burst, you can
sidestep left after the tornado and use b+2,4,3.
Use 2,3 for mid distance and df+3 for short carry.
